Reviews.Title: “Good located hotel with tasty breakfast at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: tom d
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the very centre of Madrid, where all the nice stores and good bars & restaurants are. We only stayed here one night and were very pleased with the quality this hotel had to offer at the price we payed. Our room was spacious and quite luxurious, the badroom was big and recently redone, there was a laptop and dock station in the room, and the breakfast was incredible. There also were bikes we could use without extra charge. The only negative point I could think of was the very unfriendly lady at the breakfast, but hey, everybody deserves to have a bad day once in a while. If we go to Madrid, we will try to book this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, very clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Nasim T
Reviews.Content: Pros: We just got back from our trip to Madrid and we reallyyy enjoyed our stay at Petit Palace Santa Barbara. We booked one triple and one double room and because we have asked for our rooms to be next to each other, they prepered 2 triples for us (without extra charge). -High Tech Hotel: This hotel is one of the high tech hotels and it means you have free access to internet, there is a laptop in every room and there is a printer at the front desk and they won't charge you for using it. -Staff: The staff are the best possible collection of nice, helpful, friendly and polite people. They really made us feel like home. We had several requests during our stay and they were all perfectly done. -Rooms: Both rooms were big enough, clean and comfortable, and the bathrooms were very clean. -Location: The location is perfect. It's a 15 minute walk to puerta del sol and a 10 min to Gran via avenue. The neighborhood is safe and suitable for a family. There are many bars and cafes around. Once I stayed in a hotel in puerta del sol, but I prefered this one because it's out of city center's crowded streets, yet it's only a walk away. -Check-out: The check out is at 12 but they let us stay until 1, and then they kept our luggage in a room so we could enjoy the rest of the day before leaving the city at 5. Cons: There was really nothing to complain about. The only thing was that we had attic rooms (as they explained that most of the triples are in the 4th floor). So the room just had a small window (it wasn't an issue since the room is perfectly bright with the lights) and also it made the rooms seem smaller and you may bump your head against the ceiling. But when we stated this to the front desk, they offered to change the rooms and even showed us other rooms on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Marija B
Reviews.Content: Great location, it's next to metro station and near to city center. There are some bars and restaurants by the hotel. Starbucks is near, too :) Hotel staff was very helpful, they made a reservation in some clubs for us, booked a taxi, recommended the best bars and clubs in Madrid. The rooms are clean, the bathroom is nice and big. There was no balcony in our room. It was noisy outside during the night. There was only one mirror in the room-in the bathroom. There was a computer in the room and free internet for as many devices as you wish. If you are a smoker, and you booked a non-smoking room, there is some common yard outside (next to reception) with a couple of tables, where you can sit and smoke (the internet is working there, too).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: kavitab
Reviews.Content: Negative- Staff- The male staff member who checked us in was lethargic at best, very rude, deliberately unhelpful, blatantly insulting. He refused to honor my Expedia booking, because he claimed his "colleague" who had taken my information had no authority to do so. Awkward! He was the only one in the hotel that was nasty, others were mostly cordial, though not knowledgable or helpful. Receptionist in charge of our airport transportation at departure wouldn't give us the time of day when the cars didn't turn up 30 minutes past the scheduled time. Had no apology, no recourse and couldn't be bothered once we'd settled the bill. (In hind sight this could be because we're non white. Spain is beautiful, but we were sometimes taken for "Gypsies" who have been persecuted and segregated in Europe for centuries. That could also be the reason that several Spanish locals at were rude to us). Breakfast china was very dirty both days that we ate, with coffee residue in cups, and food remnants on silverware. AT 9 Euros a person, it wasn't worth the skimpy selection, lack of refills for yoghurt, eggs, fruit, or cheese. The only thing that there was abundant of, was ham! We resorted to going down the road to a local bakery, for 6 Euros a person, we had excellent coffee, and fair breakfast foods... Bedroom had no mirrors....aside from one in the bathroom. It was inconvenient to have three people share one mirror. Positive- Complimentary computer in every room so that we could do our own research when we needed to, and check our emails etc. Bathroom was clean, clean towels etc. Hotel is energy efficient. Close proximity to Metro (Tribunal and Alonzo Martinez), the Metro in Madrid is very clean, very convenient. Taxis are cheaper if you are more than 3 people..and taxi drivers are very helpful and honest. Plaza Santa Barbara is not as noisy as many other areas of Madrid, and still close enough to all the attractions and life of this amazing city. Summary-don't look for service equality if you're brown, you should be ok if you're European, and/or caucasian. Amenities are good, location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, tastefully decorated”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. It was pretty easy to find having arrived by Metro, getting off at Alonso Martinez. The hotel is located in a square lined with bars and restaurants, with a Starbucks just round the corner by the Metro station. The hotel itself looks to be a converted Victorian mansion. The room was a good size and included a safe and minibar. The bathroom was also of a good size, though water tended to leak from the shower area into the floor around the toilet (resolved by asking for an extra towel to lay by the shower). The air conditioning worked a treat despite outside temperatures reaching 30ºC. The free wifi and Sony Vaio laptop came in very handy and worked well. Satellite TV included only 1 English channel (Discovery Max, showing some interesting documentaries). Perhaps the inclusion of a 24hr news channel would have been useful. I didn't try the breakfast which costs €10 (though there was a special August rate €8). Nor did I make use of the free bicycle hire but would come in handy for those who want to explore the city by bike. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would definitely use this hotel should I visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern interior behind a traditional facade”
Reviews.Author: mrs7777
Reviews.Content: Very modern new interior you would not expect before entering. Location ideal when visiting the center of Madrid. Many good restaurants and bars nearby. Check in took some 30 minutes for 6 with lots of confusion but it all worked out in the end. Otherwise the staff was very friendly and helpful. Although we arrived very early we got 1 room to change and refresh. Rooms are good, but there was some noise from the street ... we slept fine anyways. Excellent bathroom. Everyting clean. Good but not excellent breakfast. Rooms have a laptop and wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, well located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RLond
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights over a long weekend in June. This stylish, boutique hotel is well located in a pleasant area (Plaza Santa Barbara) right next to Alonso Martinez metro station. Only 5 minute walk to Chueca and 10 minute walk to the Gran Via shopping strip. The room is spacious, clean and modern; containing a large bathroom and shower. The only minor quips are that the room is missing some basic but useful things such as box of tissues, soap holder, and there’s a lack of drawers on either side of the bed or desk where you’d expect there to be; however there’s plenty of room to place your belongings otherwise. Also, as odd as it sounds, the furniture had a lot of sharp corners so beware when moving around the room. Free wi-fi throughout the hotel and a Sony Vaio laptop with internet in the room is a nice bonus. And the welcome notes and chocolates were a nice touch. I’d recommend having the breakfast in the hotel (was €10 extra) as it’s difficult to get similar breakfast in cafes nearby. It’s a continental buffet with delicious pastries. The hotel has a large courtyard for chilling out or tanning in the sun, though sadly doesn’t have a pool. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was good value for the price. We had a very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A very Nice experience in Madrid's city center”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was big and very well equipped. Isolation is excellent as no noise came from outside or from other rooms. The PC in the room was very helpful as we were following the pictures our son was uploading daily to the net. The hotel has a clean and modern design that matches the old building style. Breakfast was excellent -with real orange juice-. In summary we would love to repeat the experience and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: greggles16
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible by Metro from airport. Staff very helpful.Asked to change room after 1st night which was no problem & even had our luggage moved for us. Breakfast plentiful & a good standard.Location fantastic if you like to be out of the main Madrid hub but within easy walking distance.Lovely plaza immediately outside hotel with excellent coffee shop and choice of restaurants & bars if you walk around.Plaza atmosphere young student in evening & older during the day.Would definately return to this hotel & area

Reviews.Title: “An oasis Plaza de Santa Barbera”
Reviews.Author: indoitaly
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a sister hotel near Plaza Mayor, but there was a problem with the hotel and we were moved to this one. Any misgivings quickly dispersed as the rooms were large and clean and the location, while not as central was only a short walk/subway from everything. The free Internet was great, but needed continuous resetting. And as a 4 star hotel, it would have been nice if they had an arrangement with a nearby gym. With all the great food in Madrid, a workout would have been appreciated. Still, all in all, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for groups (and couples, individuals, etc!)”
Reviews.Author: angelawt
Reviews.Content: After a long Euro-trip, Madrid was the last stop, and Petit Palace Santa Barbara was the last hotel. It was a relief to know that they already had two of the rooms available for our group (of 15!) when we arrived. And even though it was earlier than the check-in time, they allowed us to use those two rooms to store our luggage, and to use the toilets, take a rest, etc. Thus, I felt that the people at the reception were very welcoming and helpful from the very first moment we arrived to the hotel ! :-). The stay was great, they had Wi-fi, one password for each user (computer), and the rooms had laptops! This was one of the best hotels we stayed at as a group, because even though our room was for 6 people, it was so spacious, and you still felt you had privacy! Very high-tech hotel as well. Location is great, but could be better (we stayed near metro Noviciado last time and I preferred that location rather than this one). Overall, it was an excellent experience, and I recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: patrick09
Reviews.Content: Had originally booked into another hotel for Madrid but then found Petit Palace Santa Barbara to be much more centrally located. Turns out I made the perfect choice! Check in was a breeze - front staff were friendly and helpful throughout our three night stay. The decor is modern in a tasteful way. The room was 'roomy' and the kids especially enjoyed the bunk beds. Madrid is definitely a walkable city and this hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk to the Grand Via in less than 10 minutes. Around the hotel are many restaurants, cafes, and bakeries - something for every meal and taste. The Metro is a very short walk from the hotel. All in all, a most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spanish tradition outside - high tech inside”
Reviews.Author: favoriter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a quiet square in the northern part of central Madrid. Easy access with the metro. From the outside it looks like a traditional Spanish building, but you get very surpriced when you enter the hotel. Everything inside - except the central stairs - is new, minimal design and high tech. Rooms have laptop, large TV, safe and minibar. The bathroom is very elegant and well functioning. The breakfast is modern and healthy, not heavy.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Palace Santa Barbara”
Reviews.Author: KalordT
Reviews.Content: Very good 4 star hotel and being under the High Tech group. You get exactly that, with blue-spot lighting in the hallways walls and motion detector overhead lights in the ceilings. That High-Tech theme continues inside the room, with an apple PC on the dresser, without any complicated logging in issues (a blessing in this day and age). I would stay here again, as it is at the top of Calle Hortelaza (so away from the never ending hubbub of Cheuea proper), there is a very lively restaurant around the corner and a Jazz club in the same building (but you hear more from the people at the restuarant than from the club itself). It has a brilliant internal courtyard area and also a breakfast room setup that is an easy going and hassle free affair, but still up to a high standard. As for the fitting out of the room itself, it is very very comfortable indeed and the shower has eveything a showering aficonado could ever need.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: itchy21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Petit Palace Santa Barbara for a 3-day city break. Great location in Chueca. The fabulous San Anton Market is 10 mins walk away. Loved the location, it has a slightly more local feel and is out of the tourist rush. It's still within a couple of metro stops from the centre of town though (5 mins). A few lovely restaurants and bars on the doorstep. Sadly didn't try the Jazz Club on Plaza Santa Barbara, but apparently its very good. 25mins to the airport by metro (Hotel is a few yards away from Alonso Martinez station. Staff was friendly and helpful. Definitely ask for a courtyard view room. Will definitely stay there again, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome stay!”
Reviews.Author: beaqueiroz
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better: in the heart of Chueca, in front of cozy and happy square St Barbara, away enough from the tourists noises/spots, but 10 meters from a metro station (Alonzo Martinez) which takes you anywhere very quickly. They have a great staff, super nice and with good tips always (a good restaurant, a good place to go...). The room was spacious, had free wifi, a laptop to us to use and a lovely balcony with the street view. I highly recommend this modern, well equipated and very friendly hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Let down by little things and lack of attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: jamestoo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located 75m from the Alonso Martinez Metro Station and is simple and quick to get to from the airport. The hotel is obviously fairly newly refurbished well appointed and trendy. First impressions after reception is the stark white decor, the room corridors have blue mood lighting and ceiling lights on short IR Timer switches. We stayed in room 220 by request which is one only rooms in the hotel with a proper double bed (rather than the normal Spanish style of a couple of singles pushed together with separate duvets) The double bed was pretty small. The room was ok, but small and a bit cramped. Cleaning left a little to be desired as on top of the rainfall shower head in the bathroom there was remnants of the former occupiers empty shampoo / shower gel bottles left behind. On retrieving the bed scatter cushions from the top of the small wardrobe where they had been chucked by the maid i was somewhat surprised to find someones empty discarded pizza box on top of the wardrobe! (See Pic). I'll wager its still there now. There were no bath robes or slippers provided however my girlfriend asked for a pair of slippers and they were duly delivered a couple of hours later by house cleaning staff. I got my pair the next evening. Neither of us got bath robes. This is somewhat cheap in my opinion as these things should be provided as a matter of course in a hotel at this price. The breakfast was disappointing when I picked up several glasses from the shelf for fresh orange juice and every one was filthy dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Some bad surprises but still I liked the hotel in general”
Reviews.Author: tyupi
Reviews.Content: This hotel itself was very nice. There is an elevator, nice old staircase, quiet courtyard at the core of the building, you may also take a bicycle to circle around the city; there is a cool shower, good laptop connected to the internet free of charge, everything good and well kept, but there are several nuances: First - about 5 am garbage bins are being emptied by city disposal service in the streets, which is so loud that the rooms which lead to the street shall be charged much less than those leading to the courtyard. Second – We were four visitors and we got a very nice price for the room. At the beginning we were even surprised why we got such a discount, but when we entered the room everything was clear. The room had 4 beds but two of them were for children (bunk beds). During reservation the pictures of such - bunk beds were not placed on the web-site and we could not imagine that we would have to sleep on them. If the hotel would have made remark on the web-site that the bed construction is like this, it would give us opportunity to get informed decision. So it was a bad surprise. In other sense the hotel was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a great property, Book your stay!”
Reviews.Author: heart/e
Reviews.Content: From its chic modern design to its dedicated family rooms (not easily found in Madrid) the Petit Palace Santa Barbara opens it very capable doors to a wide variety of clientele. This lovely boutique hotel, with spotless rooms is located on a diverse pedestrian plaza replete with sandwich shops, patisseries, a small playground, book stand and beer garden. Seconds away is the metro (with fast, easy access to city sites and the airport) as is the Chueca district full of funky shops, bars, nightclubs & restaurants. It’s a vibrant neighborhood great for strolling. You can dine with the locals and get a real sense of daily Madrid life. If you want to cover a little more ground, the hotel offers complimentary bicycles (the front desk will suggest routes!) which are located in a tranquil central courtyard with a lounge vibe, its perfect for hanging out after a long day. Breakfast is a wonderful affair where business types, travelers, revelers, couples and families (yes they have high chairs) smile, mingle and chat while enjoying the bounty before them. Rooms are outfitted with laptops and there is free wifi throughout the property. But for us what really made this property shine was the genuine warmth and hospitality that Ms. Evans and her capable staff show their guests. We simply can’t express how wonderfully pleasant a stay we had and how friendly, professional and well run this property is.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, beautiful and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: holidayheaven22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2012 for one night - with a group of 3 other girls. We wanted somewhere central as we were only in the city for the weekend. This hotel was brilliant and we all want to go back. We had a family room with a large double (2 singles pushed together as in most Spanish hotels) and bunk beds. The room was very large with modern decor and a balcony. We were worried that we'd all be crammed in together - but the room was huge and the bunk beds are in a separate area. The bathroom was a huge wet-room with a rain drop shower - perfect. The room also had a very swish laptop with free internet and a flat screen TV. Central location but couldn't hear any traffic from our room. Walking distance to Colon, Gran Via, Sol... all the shops, bars and restaurants you could want. We had the BEST steak ever at Lamucca de prado - and great cocktails in the Belvedere bar underneath Olsen restaurant (which also does brilliant Scandinavian food), all within walking distance. The hotel is a great blend of an old building (beautiful staircase) and a modern decor and facilities. The whole place was very clean - spotless. Courtyard with sofas, sun beds and free bikes for hire was an added bonus. Only a pool could have improved this hotel. Ask for a late checkout and a room at the front of the hotel for people watching from the balcony. I will definitely be back with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay, convenient, comfortable, modern.”
Reviews.Author: JWH12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for three nights in January. The staff was very helpful. The metro station, Alonso Martinez was just a short distance away. The area has a lot of options to get a meal. There were a lot of Tapas restaurants, a convenience store, pharmacy, fancy italian restaurant, burger King... and around the corner, there were several bakeries and delicatessen shops. We were there the weekend of Jan 6, and walked down to see the Cabalgata de Reyes. Just by walking down to Plaza Colon. Also, at Plaza Colon, you can take the city tour bus, if you want to get a glimpse of the city. We were told that this was a true palace at one time. that the main lobby was the carriages entrance to an internal patio. Rooms were nice, clean, and with modern decor. In particular the stairs remained with some of the original ironwork rails, and elaborate carvings in the walls. We stayed at a triple room, and it was very spacious. With a Sony computer in the room. They also had a couple of PCs in their business center. We also used their wireless wifi, with decent speed. All in all, we enjoyed very much our stay in Madrid and in particular in this hotel. Only negatives I can mention, is that bathrooms did not have odor extractors and door of the bathroom was a partially translucent glass door.

Reviews.Title: “Good outlways the bad”
Reviews.Author: Scapa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times and if it wasn't good we would have not come back. We love the area. Vibrant and lively! The bad points are the noise at night and patchy service. On balance we would recommend booking here if you can cope with a younger lifestyle! At first we did not like madrid but it grows on you! We love the Prada Gallery and the tapas. Going out for dinner at 10pm seems weird for anybody not Spanish but do as the locals do and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Pez1978
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally place to visit Madrid, we had a lovely stay and would recommend the hotel, a minor issue would be the lack of English tv stations so would recommend taking some DVD's for the free laptop. Would definitely stop again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: Jurgen V
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a one-night stop in Madrid. Location was very good, right next to the exit of the metro line 10 (Alonso Martinez). Easy connection to the airport by metro via line 10 to Nuevos Ministerios where you change on line 8 to the airport. Hotel itself looks very bright and clear. Modern rooms with all what you need. Even a laptop on the room. Free wifi. Large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Funky little hotel right next to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: lyndah50
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 2 nights at the Petit Palace Santa Barbara. The decor is very funky and fun, and the service was very good. The breakfast that was included in our room price was also excellent - good buffet with plenty of choices. Although this hotel is not in a main tourist area, it is very close (2 mins) from Alonso Martinez metro station from which you can get anywhere quickly and cheaply on the efficient Madrid metro. It is also walking distance (10 mins) from Chueca area which has great boutique shopping (lots of excellent shoe shops). I would definitely return if we visited Madrid again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom smelled very bad”
Reviews.Author: TravelNowSwUsa
Reviews.Content: The good: nice staff, great location, pretty exterior, nice. modern decor, free wifi, free computer with ethernet in room. Metro station is right there, easy connection from the airport. Take metro at airport to Ministerios, transfer then to 10 and get off at second stop (Alonso Martinez) which is where hotel is at. Great place to eat/drink is Gran Cafe Santander, kitty corner from the hotel, another great old fashioned Madrid bar is El Barrio which is one block away. Ask for interior room and it is very quiet. Must ask for nonsmoking room if you want one. The bad: the bathroom smelled really bad, like sewage. Told the maid and she sprayed aerosol which did not help. Told front desk and they said they would take care of it but did not. Had to keep bathroom door closed, it was really awful, too bad for a new, supposedly 4 star hotel. Maybe not all rooms are like this but ours (419) was. The bed was extremely hard. With all the hotels in Madrid (we go to Madrid every 2 years or so to visit family) I would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: realrestaurants
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petit Palace for a long weekend and really enjoyed it. The hotel was clean, comfortable and stylish. The staff were very professional and accommodating; I had a few extra requests and arrangements, as it was a birthday trip, that were dealt with efficiently. The room was a reasonable size and the bathroom was large with a great shower. Breakfast was good, it was not a massive selection but certainly adequate including all the items you would expect, cheese, ham, fresh breads and pastries and the staff were very pleasant. The free internet and laptop in the room was really helpful and I wish more hotels did this. There were quite a few nice bars and restaurants nearby and it is less than a minute away from the Metro. I enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but has some issues”
Reviews.Author: kingcoder
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new property located in the city center. Efficient checkin. Though I reached past mid-night the staff on duty spoke fairly good english. Internet is included in the room rent- but I had huge issues with signal in the room. They have a Sony Vaio in the room- Had to use that to catch up on stuff. The view on the side rooms is quite bad- It kind of opens in the side lane and overlooks the trash can. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel which has huge crowd till early mornings- lot of noise- At least in my room, could hear the sound hums.

Reviews.Title: “great location adn brand new”
Reviews.Author: aggie28
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located on a charling "plaza" right next to a subway sation (alfonso martinez => very easy to go to the airport by public transportation in 40 minutes max). The hotel is brand new, the room was very clean and spacious, as well as the bathroom. It is a very animated district and you will find coffees and cerveceriaright outside the hotel (very nice with late check in). The location is just awesome : not right in the middle of the city jungle but you can walk to all the main sighseeings. I highly recommend the hotel. and you can get great rates on the internet. (while booking your room, you should underline kingsize bed and not twins if you travel as a couple. We had to cope with twin beds the first night).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and modern”
Reviews.Author: Greek_Traveller_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in a quadruple room, 2 adults and 2 children.The room really exceeded expectations. Very spacious, which is a real advantage when 4 people are staying in one room, nice and comfortable bed, simple and modern decoration, with all comforts one can ask for, even a laptop connected to the Internet, as many people have already mentioned below. The bathroom was huge and very nicely equipped and taking a shower was a real pleasure (unlike in many other, even 5-star, hotels). The staff was very nice and smiling all the time. The room was also very quiet, we could not hear any disturbing noises from other rooms around. Its location was great, very close to a central metro station. Only negative comment is that we would have like some more closet space, but this is minor compared to all other advantages. All in all, a great experience. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Where to go for a perfect Madrid long weekend”
Reviews.Author: AshleyHowells
Reviews.Content: Great location, great deals right now and a great hi tec feel with essential free wi-fi and own room lap top use in a brand new modern interior. Very chic!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a new modern 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: OreoBoy
Reviews.Content: I am usually spoilt in staying at 5 star hotel and thus i find this hotel adequate and not perfect. But to be fair, it is of extreme value and definitely earn her 4 star rating. The hotel is very clean and new, the room is rather big with high ceiling. But do note that there is no amenities unlike 5 star hotels. No toothbrush, no sandals, no bottled water too i think. In summary, it is of great value and a well run 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: GrantGLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, and looks it. It's very handy to Alonso Martinez metro station and has a number of restaurants and shopping areas within a short walk. It also has a computer with free internet access in each room. Staff are friendly. The breakfasts are adequate, but the breakfast room can be quite crowded. The interior design seems to be planned to look good first and be functional second. On the negative side, the air-conditioning only works if you're in the room, so it can take a while to cool down. And if you need to sleep with the windows open, you should probably find somewhere else to stay: the area is clearly popular with drinkers, who shout and sing throughout the night on some nights.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Absolutely Amazing !!!”
Reviews.Author: Snathal
Reviews.Content: Wow! Words cannot say what an absolutely amazing wedding we had at Petit Place Santa Barbara. It was perfect, the location was beautiful and felt wonderfully intimate. All of our guests said it was the best wedding they had ever been to, and although we are biased, we agree! Staying at the venue before the wedding really added to the experience, it was so relaxing and tranquil, the rooms and grounds were out of this world. In particular our families enjoyed the food kindly provided for us at breakfast and lunch, they said it was some of the best they had ever tasted and really appreciated that it had come straight from the farm. Both our stay and the wedding were utterly magnificent and we thank all staff for making it so special, we couldn't of done it without them. X

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in town”
Reviews.Author: funkyboyVeneto
Reviews.Content: The Santa Barbara Palace is a very modern 3/4-star hotel. It is located in Plaza Santa Barbara, in the La Chueca neighbourhood, surrounded by cafés, bars, little shops, grocery stores and so on. Our room was nice and spacious and our bathroom was quite modern and very clean, with a glass-enclosed shower. All beds were comfortable thought a bit on the hard side. There is free wi-fi service. The rooms service was satisfactory. The desk staffs were very courteous without being over obsequious: they took the time to give us indications to restaurants, to move around town and so on. In summary, the Santa Barbara is a good value for the money hotel Euro and I would have no problem recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new hotel, well situated.”
Reviews.Author: BjornsonRotterdam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a small square (santa barbara) at Chueca. A nice neighberhood with fine shops, restaurants and bars. Metro station at the corner of the street but in walking distance to city centre, approximately 10-15 minutes. Brand new, nice decorated rooms with computer and free wifi. not a typical luxurieus hotel but modern and comfortabele. Beds a bit hard, rooms a little bit small and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel still 'warming up'”
Reviews.Author: Namastefi
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone for a wedding in Madrid and needed a central place. The hotel, recently refurbished is located on a nice place and you can easily walk to the city centre or the shopping area of Calle Goya. Rooms were clean, design, well acoustically isolated and I appreciated having a laptop with cable&wifi internet connection as well as a docking station radio for ipod/iphone in the room. The 'opening' rates offered (about 135 EUR/night) included free minibar (soft drinks only and not refilled over my stay) and breakfast, which was ok but behind expectations for a 4 star pretending hotel. The internal courtyard is equipped with lounge chairs and is comfy for a coffee&cigarette, but adding some green plants would make it nicer and specially would avoid echoes resonating internally. Overall a very good stay and I recommend it, but needs to go the extra mile when they will pretend billing the full price which is listed above 300 EUR.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied in a brand new hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTraveller_11
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, 20-year old son and myself) spent 2 nights in end-August at the Petit Palace Santa Barbara. We were a little hesitant when we made the reservation, since the hotel had just opened in mid-July and there were virtually no reviews or other feedback. We were very pleasantly surprised. Thus, let me try a “play by play” description before it fades from memory….. The Santa Barbara is a very modern 4-star hotel, still with some elements of “work in progress” (an extra elevator being built, etc.) but completed for all practical purposes. We were given a triple-room (406), facing the street but in the highest floor. We were not affected by the noise, yet the attic-style window did not allow for too much of a view (I understand that they have other triples with full-fledged windows). The space was very adequate (not enormous, but not tiny a la London, either). It allowed for ample space to walk around for the three of us. The bathroom was quite modern with a glass-enclosed shower (with fancy side showers as well, although you have to figure out that they are there and how they work by yourself). The water pressure was sufficient. The glass door to the bathroom, however modern, may be fine for a double room for a couple but falls short in securing a sense of privacy in the bathroom of a triple room with three adults. I would advice installing a good ol’ fashioned wood door, even if it slightly “messes up the style”.: ) All beds were quite solid (as we like them, although some people could find them too hard), and the in-room safe deposit box could comfortably accommodate a laptop computer. The room is outfitted with a laptop computer as well as free wi-fi for your own. This arrangement came quite handy to accommodate multiple guests in a triple room. The place was very clean, the rooms were serviced satisfactorily every day. The desk staffs were very correct and courteous without becoming annoyingly obsequious. Although the reception desk seemed to always have customers, they nevertheless took the time to give us indications to restaurants, to move around town, to secure a taxi back to the airport, all without any attitude. Our rate included full breakfast and the buffet hot and cold choices, while not decadent or exuberant, were quite adequate for us to last us until the typical 2 PM Madrid lunch hour. Do not despair if you don’t get breakfast, since there are plenty of bars and cafés all around the area when you can be like the locals and have your café con leche plus croissant for about 2 to 3 euros. As to the "negatives" (if you must insist on a "balanced" view....): I cannot think of its location as a negative, although some people insist on being on top of the action and this hotel is not on top, yet It is not far removed either. It is located in Plaza Santa Barbara, in the La Chueca neighbourhood, surrounded by cafés, bars, little shops, grocery stores, gay bars, you name it, it is there. It is 1 block away from the metro station and the main buses, and about a 10 minute walk to the Gran Via, 15 minute walk to Puerta del Sol, and 20 minute walk to the Museo del Prado. We were very happy every night to come back to the quiet of our hotel and not be in a room deep in the noise of the above areas. In summary, the Santa Barbara is a very good all around hotel, its triple room being a great value for the money at Euro 95 per night with breakfast (I am afraid that this rate will not last as the hotel becomes more established), and I would have no problem staying there again. If the administration can successfully maintain the level of service and quality, this hotel will become a very solid player in the Chueca barrio.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: travelBCN
Reviews.Content: Decided to go to this new hotel because of the good reviews in tripadvisor but a bit afraid because the small amount of them, but I'm very happy of my selection and I'll be back, as far as they keep prices in the current range, in all my future and usual visits to Madrid. Reception was helpful from minute zero. Kept my bags while I visited my cluents and gave me a fantastic room with very confortable beds, a rain style shower, flat hd tv and computer connected to internet included. Not a small-low class computer but a 17" sony vaio All very fashion and tastefully decorated. Breakfast, not much to choose but good quality. As in all my reviews I try to find something to criticise :-) in this case...: size of bath towels...not excellent. Also not enough toiletries for those like me that wgen preparing the bag assumes that all toiletries will be in the hotel, as you can see all very "small" In brief: excellent

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scapa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a lovely piazza and we got a nice room with a balcony but only after we complained about the first room we got ,which had a tiny roof window. The design is nice and rooms spacious. The room servicing is bit hit and miss! We did not get the room serviced till late in the afternoon and the suspicious marks on the floor round the toilet stayed there all the time of our stay. None of the English language channels on the TV worked inspite of us complaining Breakfast OK but far from special and very much basic self service. Coffee is from a machine and not great. Starbuck´s is nearby!!! There are nice Sony laptops in the room and free wifi. All in all I would recommend but the management needs to be a bit tighter!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: drstephenlee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes walk to the Metro station in a central but quiet neighbourhood. The reception staff were terrific and very helpful. The rooms were spacious and of high quality fittings. We were able to play our own music through the iPod/iPhone dock and access the Internet free. There was complimentary juice/soft drink/water in the minibar. What a pleasant surprise! And there is also complimentary bike hire. They really have thought of everything. The only very minor downside is that the bed is made from 2 single beds pushed together. Overall a very pleasant experience and we would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel Ive ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: swinny62
Reviews.Content: I had to write a review on this hotel. When looking for a four star hotel in Madrid, I was a bit jubious because this hotel only had one review but it was good enough for me to book it for me and my sister for a mini break over the bank holiday weekend. When we walked in at 12.07 am, we were greeted by a really helpful manager and then we walked into the internal courtyard, stunning. The hotel is actually a 200 year old building that has been renovated to a very high standard, and is well worth its four stars. It is a boutique hotel, very up to date, with beautifully laid out rooms, plasma screen, rainwater shower, air conditioning and laptop, very nice. Comfortable beds as well. Breakfast was very nice indeed, apart from a grumpy lady who was serving in the restaurant, she spoilt it a bit because we felt like we were inconveniencing her because the coffee machine needed filling up and she wasnt happy most of the time breakfast was served. Pastries were very fresh as was all the breakfast, nice and hot and very well organised. Didnt want to leave and would definately go back again, the reception staff were lovely and very helpful and always had a smile. Book it, you wont be disappointed. Karen Swindells

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: pppeko
Reviews.Content: Location is good. It's near the metro station and you can easily reach the hotel from airport or to the heart area of Madrid. Room is spacious and clean equipped with laptop and i-pod socket. We upload our photos every day and this helps us keep in touch with friend. Our room face to the courtyard and it's not noisy at all. The staff are helpful and lovely. Breakfast is nice and rich. The price got from internet is worthy. The only thing I don't like is the design of shower place. Water will leak out to the floor of bathroom and it might get people slip.

Reviews.Title: “Finally great hotel combining both space and comfort in a great location central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: YFetchati
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights at the Petit Palace Santa Barbara. The property is quite new and is really great hotel in a super location. Rooms are very spacious, very well designed and nicely decorated. Free minibar! I could not believe it, free laptop available and free internet access (finally, someone got it), and more over bikes, yes you heard me Free bikes that you can just take and go on a tour.. Metro station in front Alonso Martines but I was able to walk to Gran Via in 4 minutes - the area around is full of restaurants and bars. and the staff are just wonderful. I asked if I could have a late check out and not only they agreed to give me the room until 6pm, it was free... No hesitation to recommend this property..

HotelInfo.Name: Petit Palace Santa Barbara
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza Santa Barbara 10 (Alonso Martinez), 28004 Madrid, Spain
